peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is a trade payment?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Trade Payments indicate how quickly a company is likely to pay its bills in the future by reviewing its payment performance with other vendors based on aging, amount of trade, and dollar amounts.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: D&B Credit | Viewing a Report | Trade Payments - Dun & Bradstreet

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is the meaning of trade transaction?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Trade Transaction means a transaction involving the sale or purchase by Applicant of goods or services from/to a third party, and includes any contract(s) on which such transaction may be based. Trade Transaction means collectively the Purchase Transaction and the Sale Transaction.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Trade Transaction Definition | Law Insider

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is an example of a trade transaction?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: A trade transaction occurs when the customer sells or buys products or services from or to a third party. It includes any contract(s) on which the transaction is based. Trade transactions can take several forms, such as purchasing, selling, bartering, and trading.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Trade Transaction - Meaning, Examples, Steps - WallStreetMojo

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is the difference between trade and payment?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Balance of Trade focuses on goods and services. It's the difference between exports and imports. Balance of Payment includes all financial transactions. It covers goods, services, and financial transfers.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Difference Between Balance of Trade and Balance of Payment - Shiksha
